# PTD Today Forward Watchlist (Rest of Year • Headline Signals Last 30 Days)

## 1) Themes to Watch
- Offshore wind project developments and regulatory challenges in the US.
- Record solar capacity goals and CfD deployments in the UK and India.
- Solar manufacturing and module pricing shifts in China.
- Emerging AI applications in energy digital twins and data center economics.
- Subsea cable security risks and geopolitical tensions impacting data transmission.
- Semiconductor manufacturing capacity and strategic significance of new fabs.

## 2) What to Monitor Next

### Grid / Transmission
- Subsea cable vulnerability highlighted by Finnish police seizing ship for cutting cable.
- US state mandates for utilities to enable flexible grid connections for community solar.

### Renewables
- Orsted’s legal challenge against US halt of $5 billion offshore wind project signals project and permitting scrutiny.
- UK solar on track for record Contract for Difference (CfD) deployments in 2026.
- India’s mandate of 20% domestic content in battery storage projects may impact supply chains and project timelines.
- Bangladesh seeking contractors for a 220 MW solar project indicates regional solar expansion.
- Tata Power Renewable’s completion of a 1 GW DCR-compliant PV project for SJVN underscores large-scale solar capacity growth.
- China’s wafer price rise with 2026 module prices possibly hitting CNY 1/W could influence global solar PV costs.
- Apollo’s co-ownership of Hornsea 3 offshore wind farm shows investor interest in large-scale wind assets.

### Oil & Gas
- US interest and strikes in Venezuela imply geopolitical risk impacting oil production and supply stability.

### Data Centers & AI
- AI’s evolving “inference economics” and digital twins for floating PV show AI’s growing role in energy optimization.
- Semiconductor fab developments at Intel’s Arizona site underline chip manufacturing’s strategic importance linked to AI.

### Critical Minerals / Rare Earths
- Not enough information in the headlines about critical minerals or rare earth metal developments.

## 3) Regions / Companies Appearing Repeatedly
- US (offshore wind projects, solar market growth, subsea cable incidents, AI in energy).
- China (solar manufacturing, wafer pricing).
- UK (record solar CfD deployment).
- India (battery storage policies, large-scale solar manufacturing).
- Orsted (offshore wind legal challenge).
- Apollo (ownership in Hornsea 3 wind farm).
- Intel (Arizona semiconductor fab).

## 4) Constraints / Risks Implied by Headlines
- Regulatory and permit challenges potentially delaying or halting offshore wind projects (e.g. Orsted in US).
- Geopolitical risks around Venezuela may affect oil supply and markets.
- Supply chain and pricing pressures in solar PV modules due to rising wafer prices in China.
- Grid integration challenges requiring regulatory and utility adaptation to increased community solar and renewables.
- Physical security risks to subsea transmission infrastructure (cable cutting incident).
